Detailed Description

Class for global static dout object.

Usage:

For details and more examples, see the DebugPrinter member function documentation. 

using namespace DebugPrinter;

dout << "foo" << std::endl;
dout, var , 5, " bar ", 6 << " foobar " << 7, 8;

dout(object);                // highlights the object
dout_HERE                    // shortcut for  dout(__func__, __LINE__);
dout_stack(2);               // print top two stack frames
dout_FUNC                    // print current function signature
dout.type(object)            // RTTI for given object

dout = std::cout             // set output stream
dout.set_precision(13)       // set decimal display precision
dout.set_color("31")        // set terminal highlighting color

Member Function Documentation

Prints highlighted label and object.

Parameters

Example usage: 

dout(label, object);
template<typename T >
void DebugPrinter::DebugPrinter::operator() ( const T &  obj) const
inline

Prints highlighted object.

Parameters
objshould have a std::ostream & operator<< overload

Equivalent to 

dout(">>> ", obj, "");

Example usage: 

dout(label);
void DebugPrinter::DebugPrinter::operator= ( std::ostream &  os)
inline

Assignment operator for changing streams.

Parameters
osoutput stream to use

Default == std::cout. Change to any std::ostream with: 

dout = std::cerr;
void DebugPrinter::DebugPrinter::set_color ( std::string  str)
inline

Highlighting color.

Parameters
strcolor code

Assumes a bash compatible terminal and sets the operator() highlighting color, for example cyan ( == "36" == default): 

dout.set_color("36");
void DebugPrinter::DebugPrinter::set_color ( )
inline

Remvoe highlighting color.

No color highlighting (e.g. when writing to a file) Usage example: 

dout.set_color();

For bash color codes check http://www.tldp.org/HOWTO/Bash-Prompt-HOWTO/x329.html

void DebugPrinter::DebugPrinter::set_precision ( int  prec)
inline

Number of displayed decimal digits.

Parameters
precdesired precision

Default == 5. Example usage: 

dout.set_precision(12);
void DebugPrinter::DebugPrinter::stack ( const int  backtrace_size = max_backtrace,
const bool  compact = false,
const int  begin = 1 
) const
inline

Prints a stack trace.

Parameters
backtrace_sizeprint at most this many frames
compactonly print function names
beginstarting offset

Example usage: 

dout.stack();                // print a full stack trace
dout.stack(count);           // print at most (int)count frames
dout.stack(count, true);     // print in compact format
dout_FUNC                    // shortcut for  dout.stack(1, true);
